NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Computer and Funding or the cell corresponding to Environmental and Research?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Environmental} and {Research} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Aerospace and Patents or the cell corresponding to Computer and Publications?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Computer} and {Publications} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Materials and Publications or the cell corresponding to Chemical and Research?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemical} and {Research} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Civil and Funding or the cell corresponding to Civil and Research?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Civil} and {Research} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.39 to 0.43?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Aerospace, Funding), (Civil, Funding), (Computer, Funding), (Electrical, Funding), (Environmental, Funding)}.
